text.section: This section applies only in Baltimore County.

section.section: Notwithstanding the license population quota limitations and in addition to the licenses authorized for issuance under this article, the Board of License Commissioners may authorize the transfer of two beer, wine and liquor (on-sale) retail licenses in existence in election district 15 on July 1, 2004, and valid on the date of transfer into the "Hunt Valley Commercial/Mixed Use Focal Point" as designated in the Hunt Valley/Timonium Master Plan, adopted by the Baltimore County Council on October 19, 1998.

text.section: Subject to the provisions of subsection (d) of this section, the restrictions and qualifications for the issuance and fee of the Class B (HV) restaurant (on-sale) beer, wine and liquor retail license under this section, the minimum square foot area requirement for food and beverage preparation and consumption in the licensed establishment, and the days and hours of sale for the licensed establishment shall be the same as the restrictions and qualifications provided for in this article and in the regulations of the Board of License Commissioners for a Class B beer, wine and liquor (on-sale) hotel and restaurant license.
The license authorizes on-premises sales only.
The proposed premises shall comply with all applicable zoning regulations.

section.section:
Once issued, the license may not be:
Transferred to a new location other than the original location for which the license was issued; or
Converted into any other class of license.
Paragraph (1) of this subsection does not prohibit the transfer of ownership of the license.

text.section: Alcoholic beverages may be sold in the establishment only until 1:30 a.m.

The Board of License Commissioners may not issue more than a total of 3 beer, wine and liquor licenses in the Hunt Valley Commercial/Mixed Use Focal Point under the exceptions in Rule 19 of the Rules and Regulations of the Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners.
